name: live
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (to continue) to be alive or have life

example.eg: He only lived a few days after the accident.
example.egtrans: 出事后他只活了几天就死了。

example.eg: I hope I live to see my grandchildren.
example.egtrans: 我希望我能活到看见我孙辈的那一天。

example.eg: Her granny lived to the ripe old age of 94.
example.egtrans: 她奶奶活到了94岁高龄。

example.eg: Can the right to live ever be denied to any human?
example.egtrans: 人的生存权可以剥夺吗？

example.eg: She lived on well into her 90s.
example.egtrans: 她一直活到了90多岁。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be kept usually in a particular place

example.eg: Where do the knives live in your kitchen?
example.egtrans: 刀具放在你厨房的什么地方？

example.eg: I'm not sure where this bowl lives.
example.egtrans: 我不知道这只碗该放在哪里。

example.eg: Where do you live?
example.egtrans: 你住在哪里？

example.eg: We live in Kingston.
example.egtrans: 我们住在京士顿。

example.eg: Some students live on the University campus.
example.egtrans: 有些学生住在大学校园里。

example.eg: He lives with four other people in a shared house.
example.egtrans: 他和另外4个人同住在一所房子里。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spend your life in a particular way

example.eg: After a while you get used to living alone.
example.egtrans: 过一段时间你会适应一个人生活的。

example.eg: When you retire, you want to live a comfortable life.
example.egtrans: 退休的时候，大家都希望能过上舒适的生活。

example.eg: So the couple got married and lived happily ever after.
example.egtrans: 于是这对情侣结了婚，从此过上了幸福的生活。

example.eg: He simply wants to live (out) (= experience) the rest of his days in peace.
example.egtrans: 他只想能安度余生。

example.eg: The TV's broken - we'll just have to live without (= not have) it for a while.
example.egtrans: 电视机坏了 ——这段时间我们只好不看电视了。

example.eg: She certainly lived her life to the full (= was always doing something interesting).
example.egtrans: 她当然活得非常充实。

example.eg: The US is living beyond its means (= spending more than it earns).
example.egtrans: 美国人过的是借钱享乐的日子。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay alive, especially by getting enough money to pay for food, a place to stay, clothing, etc.

example.eg: For several years she lived by begging.
example.egtrans: 她以乞讨为生过了好几年。

example.eg: She has an inheritance to live off (US also live off of) so she doesn't need to work.
example.egtrans: 她可以靠遗产生活，不必工作。

example.eg: He only agreed to marry her so he could live off her (money).
example.egtrans: 他同意和她结婚只是为了她的钱。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of things that are not alive) to exist or continue to exist
trans_examp.trans_cn: （指逝去的事物）继续存在，留存

example.eg: The memory of those terrible days lives on.
example.egtrans: 对那些恐怖的日子的记忆挥之不去。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 享受生活的乐趣，尽情地享受生活

example.eg: I want to live a little before I settle down.
example.egtrans: 在安定下来之前我要好好享受一下生活。

example.eg: If you haven't seen Venice, you haven't lived.
example.egtrans: 如果你没到过威尼斯，就等于白活了一场。

name: live
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

example.eg: Millions of live animals are shipped around the world each year.
example.egtrans: 每年有数百万只动物被运到世界各地。

example.eg: There was a tank of live lobsters in the restaurant.
example.egtrans: 饭馆里有一箱活龙虾。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a performance) broadcast, recorded, or seen while it is happening
trans_examp.trans_cn: 现场直播的，实况转播的

example.eg: This evening there will be a live broadcast of the debate.
example.egtrans: 今晚将现场直播这场辩论。

example.eg: a live recording
example.egtrans: 现场录音

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a wire) carrying or charged with electricity

example.eg: a live wire
example.egtrans: 火线

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

example.eg: live rounds of ammunition
example.egtrans: 数发实弹

example.eg: live shells
example.egtrans: 实弹

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a fire, coals, or a match) still burning or able to burn
trans_examp.trans_cn: （火、煤炭或火柴）燃烧的，可燃的

example.eg: There are live coals in the fireplace.
example.egtrans: 壁炉里的煤还在燃烧。

name: live
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: broadcast as it happens; performing or being performed in front of an audience

example.eg: I've got two tickets to see them (perform) live.
example.egtrans: 我有两张看他们现场演出的门票。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a new system, especially a computer system, goes live, it starts to operate.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （新系统，尤指电脑系统）开始运行；开始工作

example.eg: Our new payments system will go live at the beginning of next month.
example.egtrans: 下个月初我们新的支付系统将开始运行。
